object.name: SuccessfulPayment
object.description: This object contains basic information about a successful payment. Note that if the buyer initiates a chargeback with the relevant payment provider following this transaction, the funds may be debited from your balance. This is outside of Telegram's control.
object.html_description: This object contains basic information about a successful payment. Note that if the buyer initiates a chargeback with the relevant payment provider following this transaction, the funds may be debited from your balance. This is outside of Telegram's control.
object.rst_description: This object contains basic information about a successful payment. Note that if the buyer initiates a chargeback with the relevant payment provider following this transaction, the funds may be debited from your balance. This is outside of Telegram's control.

annotations.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, or 'XTR' for payments in Telegram Stars
annotations.html_description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code, or “XTR” for payments in Telegram Stars
annotations.rst_description: Three-letter ISO 4217 `currency <https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments#supported-currencies>`_ code, or 'XTR' for payments in `Telegram Stars <https://t.me/BotNews/90>`_
annotations.name: currency

annotations.description: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).
annotations.html_description: Total price in the smallest units of the currency (integer, not float/double). For example, for a price of US$ 1.45 pass amount = 145. See the exp parameter in currencies.json, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).
annotations.rst_description: Total price in the *smallest units* of the currency (integer, **not** float/double). For example, for a price of :code:`US$ 1.45` pass :code:`amount = 145`. See the *exp* parameter in `currencies.json <https://core.telegram.org/bots/payments/currencies.json>`_, it shows the number of digits past the decimal point for each currency (2 for the majority of currencies).
annotations.name: total_amount

annotations.description: Expiration date of the subscription, in Unix time; for recurring payments only
annotations.html_description: Optional. Expiration date of the subscription, in Unix time; for recurring payments only
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Expiration date of the subscription, in Unix time; for recurring payments only
annotations.name: subscription_expiration_date

annotations.description: True, if the payment is a recurring payment for a subscription
annotations.html_description: Optional. True, if the payment is a recurring payment for a subscription
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. True, if the payment is a recurring payment for a subscription
annotations.name: is_recurring

annotations.description: True, if the payment is the first payment for a subscription
annotations.html_description: Optional. True, if the payment is the first payment for a subscription
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. True, if the payment is the first payment for a subscription
annotations.name: is_first_recurring

annotations.description: Identifier of the shipping option chosen by the user
annotations.html_description: Optional. Identifier of the shipping option chosen by the user
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Identifier of the shipping option chosen by the user
annotations.name: shipping_option_id

annotations.description: Order information provided by the user
annotations.html_description: Optional. Order information provided by the user
annotations.rst_description: *Optional*. Order information provided by the user
annotations.name: order_info
